prompt: Create Cisco IOS XR 7.0.1 MDT configuration for hardware inventory/state: stream inventory entities and platform slot instance state. Use gRPC no TLS. Collector 192.0.2.196 port 57500. Sample every 10 minutes.
candidate:
telemetry model-driven
 sensor-group HW-INVENTORY-STATE
  sensor-path Cisco-IOS-XR-asr9k-lc-pwrglide-cfg:hardware-module-port-mode/config-mode
  sensor-path Cisco-IOS-XR-asr9k-lc-pwrglide-cfg:hardware-module-port-mode/config-mode/node/port-mode
 !
 destination-group DG-GRPC
  address-family ipv4
   destination 192.0.2.196
    port 57500
    encoding self-describing-gpb
    protocol grpc no-tls
 !
 subscription SUB-HW-INVENTORY-STATE
  sensor-group-id HW-INVENTORY-STATE sample-interval 600000
  destination-group-id DG-GRPC
 !
expected:
telemetry model-driven
 sensor-group INV-OPER
  sensor-path Cisco-IOS-XR-invmgr-oper:inventory/entities/entity
  sensor-path Cisco-IOS-XR-platform-oper:platform/racks/rack/slots/slot/instances/instance/state
 !
 subscription SUB-INV
  sensor-group-id INV-OPER sample-interval 600000
  destination-group-id DG-INV
 !
 destination-group DG-INV
  address-family ipv4 192.0.2.196 port 57500
   encoding self-describing-gpb
   protocol grpc no-tls
  !
 !
!
rationale: The candidate config uses the correct IP, port, transport (grpc no-tls), and encoding as requested. However, the sensor-paths are unrelated to the user's request for hardware inventory and platform slot instance state; instead, it configures unrelated sensor-paths for hardware-module-port-mode. The destination group and subscription names differ but that is acceptable. The sample interval is close enough. Due to incorrect sensor-paths, the score is low despite correct transport and destination settings.
